result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory D Farmer Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,125.00 payable to Wisconsin Department of Justice Criminal Investigations to be paid through collection of DOC.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance upon release to Extended supervision shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
**5/4/2016 Honorable Carolina M. Stark-Order signed.  DNA surcharge on count two is vacated.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to counts two and five; consecutive to count four. Credit for three days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No alcohol.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any firearms or weapons.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
May not possess any type of digital scales.
May not possess cash greater than $250.00 at any one time.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Defendant must provide a DNA sample, pay all costs.
Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.13 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision and a violation of any of those conditions ay result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count one and five, consecutive to count four. Credit for three days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count five; consecutive to counts one and two. Credit for zero days.

In Wisconsin State Prison system.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to counts one, two and four. Credit for three days.

Court ordered at the Sentencing Hearing 8-26-2014, a document is to remain sealed in the Court file. 
Document is sealed in manilla envelope and in the Court file.

Defendant Gregory D Farmer in court with attorney Rebecca M. Coffee.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Tanisha J.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and 5, consecutive to COUNT 4, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Court orders Restitution in the amount of $1,125.00 payable to Wisconsin Department of Justice Criminal Investigations to be paid through collection of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and 5, consecutive to COUNT 4, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 4 years. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 4: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 5, consecutive to COUNT 1 and 2, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 4 years. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 5: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 1,2, AND 4, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 MONTHS.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant may not possess any type of digital scales. 
- Defendant  may not possess cash greater than $250 at any one time. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Gregory D Farmer in court with attorney Rebecca M. Coffee.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, room 313 of the safety building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 4:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 3:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 4 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

AS TO COUNT 5:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored. Defendant MUST provide a DNA sample and pay all costs.

Defendant Gregory D Farmer in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State Count 5 AMENDED from Resisting or Obstructing an Officer  TO Obstructing an Officer under Wisconsin Stats. 946.41(1) a Class A Misdemeanor. Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
